summary: Mobile app: Pacemaker-style AI DJ mixer — a touch-first AI-assisted DJ mixing experience with dual decks, gesture controls, reactive neon visuals, track analysis, AI transitions/recommendations, recording/sharing, and beginner/pro modes.
architectural_notes: Design philosophy: app should feel like an instrument; every gesture yields immediate musical feedback
Experience goal: enable non-DJs to sound professional within seconds while retaining deep control for advanced users
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal neon metronome/pacemaker-inspired app icon on dark background (app-icon.dim_1024x1024.png)
- Subtle dark neon grid/particle background texture (neon-bg-texture.dim_2048x2048.png)
- Set of 6 monochrome neon line icons: play, pause, cue, loop, fx, sync (dj-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Implement a mobile-first core DJ mixing UI with two virtual decks and a central crossfader. Each deck must display a scrolling waveform, BPM, key, track progress, and loop/cue controls; the crossfader must blend the audible output between decks.

Add music input flows that allow users to import audio from local files. Provide a clear UI affordance for connecting to a streaming library as a placeholder integration (UI + data model), without relying on unsupported third-party auth or proprietary SDKs.

Perform client-side track analysis when a track is imported/loaded: estimate BPM, musical key, waveform data for rendering, and compute an energy metric; infer a simple structure timeline (intro/verse/drop/outro) suitable for UI markers and AI mixing heuristics.

Implement gesture-based performance interactions: swipe to crossfade, pinch to control filters, tap to trigger effects, press-and-hold for looping, and circular motion gestures for EQ/FX modulation. Gestures must work with touch and pointer events.

Add core mixing and AI-assisted features: automatic beatmatching/tempo sync between decks, a one-tap “AI transition” that performs a musical transition between the current and next deck, intelligent track recommendations based on key/BPM/energy, and a continuous auto-mix mode that sequences tracks like a DJ set.
Implement effects and performance tools per deck: LPF/HPF filter, echo, reverb, beat repeat, quantized looping, and hot cues. Controls must be touch-friendly and designed for real-time performance.

Create a dark, minimal, neon-accented visual system with smooth, rhythmic animations. Waveforms and background elements must react in real time to audio frequency and intensity to create a visually reactive performance feel.

Add onboarding and mode selection with two modes: Beginner mode with AI assistance that keeps playback and mixing in sync automatically, and Pro mode that enables full manual control of sync and performance parameters.

Support recording the mixed output as a single audio file on the client and provide export/share options (at minimum: download to device). Persist only lightweight metadata in the backend (e.g., mix title, timestamps, track IDs), avoiding uploading large audio binaries to the canister by default.

Define and apply a coherent visual theme consistent with the product domain (“instrument, not tool”): typography, spacing, component styling, interaction feedback, and motion guidelines must be applied consistently across all screens in the app.

Add required generated static images to the project under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (e.g., app icon and subtle background texture), without routing image delivery through the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create mobile app project “Pacemaker-style AI DJ mixer” (touch-first DJ mixing experience)
Music input: import local audio files and connect to a streaming library
Track analysis: detect BPM, key, waveform, energy level, and song structure (intro/verse/drop/outro)
Main DJ UI: two virtual decks + central crossfader with waveform, BPM/key, progress, loop & cue controls
Gesture-based interaction: swipe crossfade, pinch filters, tap FX, hold looping, circular EQ/FX modulation
AI mixing features: auto beatmatching/tempo sync, key/BPM/energy-based recommendations, one-tap AI transition, continuous auto-mix mode
Effects/performance tools: LPF/HPF, echo/reverb, beat repeat, quantized looping, hot cues
Visual system: dark minimal neon UI with real-time audio-reactive waveforms/background and smooth rhythmic animations
Recording & sharing: record mix to single audio file and export/share
Onboarding + modes: beginner mode with AI assistance and pro mode with full manual control

Implement backend persistence in the single Motoko main actor for user-scoped library and session data: imported track metadata (including analysis results) and recorded mix session metadata. Provide query/update methods needed by the frontend via the generated actor interface.
